title: Introduction to Road Safety
description: Learn the fundamental principles of road safety and defensive driving techniques.
objectives: Understand the importance of road safety

slides.title: Welcome to Road Safety Training
slides.content: Road safety is everyone's responsibility. This module will teach you essential skills to become a safer, more responsible driver.

slides.title: The Importance of Road Safety
slides.content: Every year, thousands of lives are lost due to road accidents. Understanding and practicing road safety can prevent these tragedies and protect you, your passengers, and other road users.

slides.title: Defensive Driving Principles
slides.content: Defensive driving means anticipating dangerous situations and making safe decisions. Always stay alert, maintain safe following distances, and be prepared for the unexpected actions of other drivers.

title: Traffic Rules and Regulations
description: Comprehensive guide to Philippine traffic laws and regulations.

slides.title: Philippine Traffic Laws Overview
slides.content: The Land Transportation and Traffic Code governs all road users in the Philippines. Knowing these laws is essential for safe and legal driving.

slides.title: Right-of-Way Rules
slides.content: Understanding who has the right-of-way in various situations prevents accidents. At intersections without signals, vehicles on the right generally have priority. Always yield to emergency vehicles.

slides.title: Speed Limits and Zones
slides.content: Speed limits vary by location: 30 km/h in school zones, 40 km/h in residential areas, 60 km/h on city roads, and up to 100 km/h on expressways. Always adjust speed to road and weather conditions.

title: Vehicle Safety and Maintenance
description: Essential vehicle maintenance and safety checks for motorcycles and cars.
objectives: Identify warning signs of mechanical issues
Learn proper tire and brake care

slides.title: Pre-Ride Safety Inspection
slides.content: Before every ride, check: tires (pressure and tread), brakes (function and fluid), lights (all working), mirrors (properly adjusted), and oil levels. A quick inspection can prevent breakdowns and accidents.

slides.title: Tire Maintenance
slides.content: Proper tire pressure improves handling and fuel efficiency. Check pressure weekly. Replace tires when tread depth falls below 1.6mm. Rotate tires every 10,000 km for even wear.

slides.title: Brake System Care
slides.content: Brakes are your vehicle's most critical safety feature. Have them inspected every 6 months. Warning signs include squealing, grinding noises, or soft brake pedals. Never ignore these symptoms.

title: Motorcycle Safety Fundamentals
description: Specialized safety training for motorcycle riders.

slides.title: Essential Protective Gear
slides.content: Always wear: DOT-approved helmet, motorcycle jacket with armor, gloves, long pants, and proper footwear. Protective gear reduces injury severity by up to 50% in accidents.

slides.title: Motorcycle Control Basics
slides.content: Master clutch and throttle control, smooth braking with both front and rear brakes, and proper body positioning. Practice in safe areas before riding in traffic.

slides.title: Lane Positioning Strategy
slides.content: Position yourself where you're most visible to other drivers. Avoid blind spots. Use the left third of the lane on multi-lane roads. Adjust position based on road conditions and traffic.

title: Road Signs and Markings
description: Complete guide to understanding traffic signs, signals, and road markings.

slides.title: Types of Road Signs
slides.content: Regulatory signs (red/blue) tell you what you must or must not do. Warning signs (yellow) alert you to hazards. Guide signs (green/blue) provide directions. Learn to recognize each type instantly.

slides.title: Common Road Markings
slides.content: Solid white lines: no lane changing. Broken white lines: changing allowed. Yellow lines: separate opposing traffic. White arrows: required direction. Pedestrian crossings: yield to pedestrians.

slides.title: Traffic Light Sequences
slides.content: Green: proceed with caution. Yellow: prepare to stop if safe. Red: stop completely. Flashing yellow: slow and proceed with caution. Flashing red: treat as stop sign.

title: Weather and Night Riding
description: Safe driving techniques for adverse weather and low-light conditions.

slides.title: Riding in Rain
slides.content: Reduce speed by 30% in wet conditions. Increase following distance to 4-6 seconds. Avoid sudden braking or sharp turns. Be extra cautious on painted road markings and metal surfaces.

slides.title: Night Riding Safety
slides.content: Ensure all lights work properly. Reduce speed to compensate for reduced visibility. Watch for pedestrians and animals. Avoid staring at oncoming headlights. Use high beams when appropriate.

slides.title: Fog Navigation
slides.content: Use low-beam headlights (high beams reflect off fog). Reduce speed significantly. Use fog lights if equipped. Follow road markings closely. Increase following distance to 6-8 seconds.

title: Emergency Vehicles and Accident Response
description: How to handle emergency situations and respond to accidents properly.

slides.title: Brake Failure Response
slides.content: Don't panic. Pump the brake pedal rapidly. Shift to lower gear to slow down. Use emergency brake gradually. Look for escape route or safe area to stop. Avoid collisions if possible.

slides.title: Tire Blowout Procedure
slides.content: Grip steering wheel firmly. Don't brake immediately. Let vehicle slow naturally. Steer straight. Once speed drops, brake gently and move to roadside. Turn on hazard lights.

slides.title: Accident Scene Protocol
slides.content: Ensure scene safety. Call emergency services (911). Provide first aid if trained. Don't move injured unless necessary. Exchange information with other parties. Document scene with photos. File police report.

title: Defensive Driving Advanced Techniques
description: Advanced defensive driving strategies for experienced riders.

slides.title: The SIPDE Process
slides.content: Scan: constantly scan the road environment. Identify: recognize potential hazards. Predict: anticipate what might happen. Decide: choose the best response. Execute: take appropriate action smoothly.

slides.title: 360-Degree Awareness
slides.content: Check mirrors every 3-5 seconds. Monitor peripheral vision. Identify escape routes. Track vehicles in adjacent lanes. Watch for pedestrians and cyclists. Stay aware of road surface conditions.

slides.title: Reading Other Drivers
slides.content: Watch vehicle positioning and speed changes. Note brake lights early. Observe driver behavior (phone use, erratic movement). Predict lane changes from turn signals and body language. Expect the unexpected.

title: Alcohol, Drugs, and Impaired Driving
description: Understanding the dangers of impaired driving and legal consequences.

slides.title: Alcohol and Driving Don't Mix
slides.content: Even small amounts of alcohol impair judgment, reaction time, and coordination. Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) of 0.05% doubles accident risk. BAC of 0.08% is illegal and increases risk by 11 times.

slides.title: Medication and Driving
slides.content: Many medications cause drowsiness, dizziness, or impaired coordination. Read warning labels. Consult your doctor about driving. Common culprits: antihistamines, pain relievers, anxiety medications.

slides.title: Legal Consequences
slides.content: DUI penalties: license suspension, heavy fines, possible jail time, criminal record. Accidents while impaired can result in manslaughter charges. Insurance rates skyrocket. Lives destroyed. Never drive impaired.

title: Sharing the Road
description: Safely sharing the road with other vehicles, cyclists, and pedestrians.
objectives: Handle school buses and emergency vehicles

slides.title: Large Vehicle Safety
slides.content: Trucks and buses have large blind spots. If you can't see the driver's mirrors, they can't see you. Don't cut in front of large vehicles - they need more stopping distance. Pass quickly and safely.

slides.title: Cyclist Safety
slides.content: Give cyclists at least 1 meter clearance when passing. Check mirrors and blind spots before turning right. Watch for cyclists at intersections. Never honk aggressively. They have equal road rights.

slides.title: Pedestrian Right-of-Way
slides.content: Always yield to pedestrians in crosswalks. Stop completely behind the crosswalk line. Watch for pedestrians at intersections. Be extra cautious near schools and residential areas. Children are unpredictable.

title: Environmental and Eco-Friendly Riding
description: Reduce your environmental impact through efficient riding practices.

slides.title: Fuel-Efficient Riding Techniques
slides.content: Maintain steady speeds. Avoid aggressive acceleration and braking. Keep tires properly inflated. Remove unnecessary weight. Use cruise control on highways. Plan routes to minimize distance.

slides.title: Reducing Emissions
slides.content: Regular maintenance keeps emissions low. Replace air filters regularly. Fix leaks promptly. Don't idle for extended periods. Combine trips. Consider carpooling. Every small action helps the environment.

slides.title: Proper Disposal and Recycling
slides.content: Dispose of oil, batteries, and tires properly at designated facilities. Never pour oil down drains. Recycle when possible. Use eco-friendly cleaning products. Maintain your vehicle to extend its life.
